discourse_list.title: The problems of not having a Marketing Core Unit in place (YET)

content.content: Sorry if this is not the place to post this thread. But I don’t know exactly were to put it. We can see the other protocols like AAVE, Compound and recent competitors like Liquity positioning themselves as sponsors of different community events, grants and tools. Recently:   defi.ethglobal.co    HackMoney - Virtual DeFi Hackathon HackMoney is a virtual 30 day hackathon for hackers building decentralized finance applications.        ethcc.io    EthCC 4 — July 20-22, 2021 Ethereum Community Conferences & Workshops: 20-21-22 July2021 in Paris      Even MakerDAO has already a brand built, we need to keep positioning ourselves not only to show support and create awareness, but to attract talent and create new ideas and initiatives that benefit the ecosystem. I have seen some of the proposals for marketing, but I think we have to keep in mind that we need to attract not only normies and corporations but also developers and degens. Talent is starting to flow from web2 to web3 , AAVE and others are there with arms open, let’s be there too. It will be nice to have a roadmap of future events and how Maker is going to propose challenges, collaborations and so on. Just some thoughts,

I agree that Marketing should include advertising MakerDAO to prospective employees/investors in the protocol. Some low hanging fruit like advertising Maker on the Brave browser or Twitter/Facebook would raise awareness and bring more people into the fold.
